Contributing to programets

Source: CONTRIBUTING.md

Thank you for your interest in contributing to programets! This document provides guidelines and information about how you can contribute.

Code of Conduct

By participating in this project, you agree to abide by our Code of Conduct. Please read it before contributing.

How to Contribute

Reporting Issues

Found a bug or have a feature request? Please open an issue at GitHub Issues.

When reporting a bug, please include:

  • A clear description of the problem
  • Steps to reproduce the issue
  • Expected behavior vs actual behavior
  • Your R version and operating system
  • Output from sessionInfo()

Proposing Changes

We welcome pull requests! Here’s how to get started:

  1. Fork the repository and clone it locally
  2. Create a branch for your changes: git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name
  3. Make your changes following the code style guidelines below
  4. Test your changes by running devtools::check()
  5. Commit your changes with a clear commit message
  6. Push your branch and open a pull request

Development Setup

For detailed development setup instructions, including Google Analytics authentication and encryption configuration, see DEVELOPER.md.

Basic setup:

# Install development dependencies
devtools::install_deps(dependencies = TRUE)

# Run tests
devtools::test()

# Run R CMD check
devtools::check()

Code Style

This project uses lintr for code style enforcement:

  • Use 2-space indentation
  • Follow the tidyverse style guide
  • Document functions using roxygen2 comments

Run the linter before submitting:

lintr::lint_package()

Questions?

If you have questions, feel free to open an issue or reach out to the maintainers listed in the README.
